title: tClear - not really a strip miner, EP 23 Turtle Programs
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: tClear - not really a strip miner, EP 23 Turtle Programs
videoDescription:
This program clears a specified cuboid (depths x width x height) from all blocks. In the normal mode the turtle digs 3 layers in one go. The option "layerByLayer" can be used e.g. for mining obsidian. The turtle mines and moves only within the specified area. The option "stripMiner" kind of missus the program for strip mining. However, there is no inventory management or torch placement. Hope this helps you. Enjoy! :)

Timestamps: WORK IN PROGRESS!
00:00 Intro
00:50 Program idea
01:25 Demo dig cuboid
02:38 Demo: mining obsidian (option: layerByLayer)
04:15 Demo: dig basement (option: within)
06:25 Positive and negative prameters
09:08 Pastebin and info screens
11:59 Demo: strip miner (option: stripminer)
13:32 Code: shell.run()
14:40 Outro, preview teaser, outtakes

Links:
Need an intro to turtles? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgbdfJpt7Ks&t=906s


Get it either using the tLoader program: tLoader tClear
Or the "old fashioned" way: pastebin get 07653J4E tClear

***** Valuable info sources *****
The ComputerCraft forum: https://forums.computercraft.cc/
The CC:Tweaked wiki:  https://tweaked.cc/module/turtle.html
Programming language LUA: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/

***** About ComputerCraft *****
CC:Tweaked by SquidDev is the current fork of ComputerCraft. ComputerCraft is originally a mod by dan200, which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft.

***** About the modpack *****
I'm using FTB modpack Direwolf20 1.16 (v1.7.0). You need for this the Java version of Minecraft and FTB App (https://feed-the-beast.com/​).

***** Questions and Feedback *****
Please, comment the video and maybe share some of your ideas for future turtle programs. Like and subscribefor more videos.

Hope you enjoy, have fun!!

- - - - - - - - - -

title: tWaitFor - password door, remote door, traps and more, EP 24 Turtle Programs
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: tWaitFor - password door, remote door, traps and more, EP 24 Turtle Programs
videoDescription:
In this episode I demonstrate you how easy to use and useful ComputerCraft events can be. The two programs tWaitFor and tSend make utilizing events simple and can be applied in many different ways to increase interaction between turtles and players. There are detailed timestamps, so you can skip to the different scections. Enjoy! :)

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
01:01 Program idea
02:13 Overview demo applications
03:47 Demo of all 5 events used (using progam call)  
05:39 Demo trap program (using Lua interpreter, simple)
07:44 Demo turtle synchronization (using Lua interpreter, complex)
08:41 Demo remote doors (using startup, simple)
10:33 Demo ring the bell (using startup, multiple reactions)
11:43 Code walkthrough bell
15:16 Demo door security (using complex startup, multiple event tests)
17:00 Code walkthrough security
25:08 Variation on door security set-up
26:10 Pastebin get
27:18 Info screens
31:29 Noteblock demo

Links:
Need an intro to turtles? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgbdfJpt7Ks&t=906s

pastebin get 9vzPCd4T tWaitFor
pastebin get h3xcC9S1 tSend
Or download using the latest version of tLoader (TUAP1vFU).

For easier access I put here the startup program of the "bell turtle":

-- example program to demonstrate different reaction 
--   on different events triggered using the return value of tWaitFor

local returnValue  -- here we'll store the values returned by tWaitFor

-- infinite loop
while true do
  -- call the tWaitFor program with the help of some lua magic ;)
  returnValue = assert(loadfile("tWaitFor") ("rn", "1",  "ding", 
                                             "rn", "2",  "alarm",
                                             "al","12.0","12.0"))
  if returnValue == 1 then
    -- single ding by rednet
    redstone.setOutput("front",true)
    sleep(1)
    redstone.setOutput("front",false)
 
  elseif returnValue == 2 then
    -- 20 alarm rings
    for i = 1,20 do
      redstone.setOutput("front",true)
      sleep(0.1)
      redstone.setOutput("front",false)
      sleep(0.1)
    end
  
  elseif returnValue == 3 then
    -- 4 dings at noon
    for i = 1,4 do
      redstone.setOutput("front",true)
      sleep(1)
      redstone.setOutput("front",false)
      sleep(1)
    end  
  end
end  -- end of program




***** Valuable info sources *****
The ComputerCraft forum: https://forums.computercraft.cc/


The CC:Tweaked wiki:  https://tweaked.cc/module/turtle.html
Programming language LUA: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.1/

***** About ComputerCraft *****
CC:Tweaked by SquidDev is the current fork of ComputerCraft. ComputerCraft is originally a mod by dan200, which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft.

***** About the modpack *****
I'm using FTB modpack Direwolf20 1.16 (v1.7.0). You need for this the Java version of Minecraft and FTB App (https://feed-the-beast.com/​).

***** Questions and Feedback *****
Please, comment the video and maybe share some of your ideas for future turtle programs. Like and subscribefor more videos.

Hope you enjoy, have fun!!

title: Mob Farm
videoTitle: Computercraft - Turtle Programs, Ep 03: Mob Farm
videoDescription:
The third episode of my 'Turtle Programs' series is about building a mob farm with a normal turtle (so no diamonds needed for tools). I explain how to use the turtle program build_MobFarm and what options you have (excluding 2 hidden decorative options ;). Of course we also watch in a timelapse the turtle building the mob farm. You can download the program from pastebin. If you have problems using the program, leave me a comment and I'll try to help. Hope it helps in getting experience and drops in early game.

Update 2015-01-05: Now the turtle should no longer run away when shift clicking materials into its inventory :)

Links:
program build_MobFarm: http://pastebin.com/unPPhDpQ
video where I use this program: not so far, but there will be one

About the mods:
I'm using FTB modpack Direwolf20 1.5 (v1.1.2) with CameraStudio (v2.8.5).
Turtles are part of dan200's mod computercraft which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft: http://www.computercraft.info
Computercraft uses the programming language LUA: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/

Music:
Beachfront Celebration, by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com).

Questions and Feedback:
As every (new) youtuber I'm very interested in your opinion. Please, comment the video and maybe share some of your ideas for future turtle builds. Please, like and subscribe if you want to see more videos.

Hope you enjoy, have fun!!

title: Turtle Programs, Ep 11: Tree Farm (pastebin: Qn008fPa)
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Turtle Programs, Ep 11: Tree Farm (pastebin: Qn008fPa)
videoDescription:
NEW PASTEBIN LINK: http://pastebin.com/Qn008fPa

In this epsiode you will learn about the automated Tree Farm program, which won the poll I did for you. I show you how to download the program, make the turtle set-up the tree farm (optional), how to run the farm and I explain some of the program mechanics. You can either use a crafty felling turtle or a crafty mining turtle to run this automated farm that will provide you thousands of wood :)
To keep this video short I split it up in two parts. All the important stuff to run the progam is in this first part, so don't you worry ;)
Hope this helps you especially in early game. Enjoy! :)

2018-01-07 update v1.40: bugfix turtle start position

title: Automated Harvester, EP 20 Turtle programs
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Automated Harvester, EP 20 Turtle programs
videoDescription:
In this episode I show you a very versatile automated harvester turtle program. It even creates a startup file, so it boots automatically when the game is loaded. While not beeing optimized for one pant type or specified farm size, it can handle a bunch of plants (that grow from a source block) and you have great freedom about the shape of the harvesting area. Hope this helps you ... Enjoy! :)

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro
00:24 Program idea
01:35 Demo farm building (time lapse 1)
06:45 Melon and pump farm (time lapse 2)
09:46 Bamboo farm (time lapse 3, notDown)
12:50 Chest placement and kelp farm (time lapse 4)
15:26 Lossless kelp farm (time lapse 5)
16:31 Mushroom farm (time lapse 6, notUp)
19:17 17 different plants farm including nether vines
26:00 Demo setup auto boot (startup)
27:39 Multiple turtles and program details (noCannibalism)
35:33 Farewell and outro

pastebin get ZVc6H649 aHarvester
(program name is required for auto boot)

List of parameters:
notDown, notUp, minFuelxxxx, critFuelxxxx, n1(=waiting at home), n2 (=max. # turns), noCannibalism

title: Platforms
videoTitle: ComputerCraft - Turtle Programs, Ep 04: Platforms
videoDescription:
In this episode of my 'Turtle Programs' series I present you a program which builds rectangular platforms of any size for you. I explain how to use the turtle program tPlatform and show you several possible applications. This includes an example how to combine several program calls to build more complex buildings. Of course we also have some timelapse scenes (sorry for the bad quality of the first, the second is again nice ). You can download the program from pastebin. If you have problems using the program, leave me a comment and I'll try to help. Hope it helps you in building whatever needs some platforms ;)

Update 2015-03-21: Tied up the code a little bit.
Update 2015-03-28: Selects slot 1 at start, thx Robinn57.
Update 2016-02-28: Now the turtle will tell you if you need to (manually) refuel it

title: Turtle Programs, Ep 07: build Mob Head
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Turtle Programs, Ep 07: build Mob Head
videoDescription:
In this episode of 'Turtle Programs' we meet again turtle T17 and learn about the turtle program buildHead. With it you can build more than 16 different mob heads (for the exact number you can either count them in the video or have a look into the code). All heads are 8x8 and can be built horizontally as a platform or vertically like a wall. I will also submit this program to dan200, as he is looking for community made programs to include in ComputerCraft. This would be great :) In the final time-lapse we see 14 turtles many, many heads,enjoy! :)

Links:

title: Donkey Sanctuary
videoTitle: ComputerCraft - Turtle Programs, Ep 05: Donkey Sanctuary
videoDescription:
In this episode of 'Turtle Programs' we see a pixelart from Genericb. The Donkey Sanctuary he built for his beloved donkey Danger Zone. Well, actually it is not the complete sanctuary, but the entrance. I also introduce you to my special turtle T17, it has some more tricks on board than my other turtles ;)
Beside the time lapse for the sanctuarty there is a second one for even more donkeys :)

title: Turtle Programs, Ep 08: Applied Energistics Crystals
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Turtle Programs, Ep 08: Applied Energistics Crystals
videoDescription:
In this episode of 'Turtle Programs' a turtle helps us with growing crystals in an ME system of Applied Energistics 2. The turtle manages all three typs of pure crystals (certus, nether, fluix) and the regular (none pure) fluix crystal. Hope this helps you to set up your ME system. Enjoy! :)

Updated 2015-02-27: Sleep time default is now 20 sec.

Links:
program aAESeeds: http://pastebin.com/stXEtJ6C
AE2 intro by direwolf20: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=duFp8qP-308 (first video)

About the mods:
I'm using FTB modpack Direwolf20 1.7 (v1.0.3) with CameraStudio (v2.1710) and Fastcraft (v1.9).
Turtles are part of dan200's mod computercraft which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft: http://www.computercraft.info
Computercraft uses the programming language LUA: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/

title: Turtle Programs, Ep 16: Botania Endoflame Feeder
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Turtle Programs, Ep 16: Botania Endoflame Feeder
videoDescription:
Today I saw Direwolf20's Let's Play where he built a really compact contraption to feed his Endoflames from Botania in only 3 block spaces. He then added, that he challenges everyone to do this in a smaller space: Challenge accepted :)

Dire's challenge: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=muvwWclzWhw @14:38

aEndoFeeder pastebin code : bMHsGY06

Forgot to say: If you start the program without paramters, you will get the usual info screens. 

Hope this helps you ... . Enjoy! :)

About the mods:
I'm using FTB Presents Direwolf20 1.12 (v1.4.0) and added ComputerCraft (v1.80pr1).
Turtles are part of dan200's mod computercraft which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft: http://www.computercraft.info

No animals were harmed during the making of this movie.

title: Rapid Fire Prank Drone, EP 21 Turtle programs
videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Rapid Fire Prank Drone, EP 21 Turtle programs
videoDescription:
This time it's prank time :D The program builds either a regular prank drone or a rapid fire drone, that you can start via wireless commands. The rapid fire drone can shoot up 2880 arrows in one go. If you're using TNT, choose your target wisely. Enjoy! :)

Timestamps:
00:00 Intro and TNT
01:04 Prank drone
03:54 Rapid fire drone
05:43 Refill drone  
08:00 Fire command
09:27 Self-experiment

Links:
Need an intro to turtles? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZgbdfJpt7Ks&t=906s
FalseSymmetry's video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mRi6_zpV-qQ
Reddit source: https://www.reddit.com/r/Minecraft/comments/ld2uu9/so_i_made_a_drone_that_drops_packages_every/

pastebin get A35d84ge bDrone

***** Valuable info sources *****
The ComputerCraft forum: https://forums.computercraft.cc/
The CC:Tweaked wiki:  https://tweaked.cc/module/turtle.html
Programming language LUA: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/

***** About ComputerCraft *****
CC:Tweaked by SquidDev is the current fork of ComputerCraft. ComputerCraft is originally a mod by dan200, which is about computers, programming and robotics in minecraft.

***** About the modpack *****
I'm using FTB modpack Direwolf20 1.16 (v1.16). You need for this the Java version of Minecraft and FTB App (https://feed-the-beast.com/​).

videoTitle: ComputerCraft: Loader - The Lord of the Pastebin Codes, EP 22 Turtle programs
videoDescription:
One Pastebin code to rule them all. One Pastebin code to finde them.
One Pastebin code to bring them all and on the hard drive bind them.
This is the true Pastebin code!

Only one code to remember and it is (hopefully) easy:
T = To
U = YOU
A = All
P = Programs
v = version
1 = one
FU = FU**?!

Enjoy! :)
